title: Productive Failure Learning Strategies for Understanding Pharmaceuticals

context.prior_knowledge: Basic Understanding of Pharmaceutical Terminology and Human Physiology
context.additional_context: Learners are medication users without professional expertise, utilizing discussion boards and video lectures within an LMS (Learning Management System).

learning_goals: Learners can analyze and correct self-generated errors in the problem-solving process using real pharmaceutical cases.
Learners can solve pharmaceutical calculation problems (e.g., renal function estimation) with 80% or higher accuracy.

By the end of the four-week course, learners analyze three provided pharmaceutical development cases, derive core issues, and create a conceptual framework following a five-stage "pharmaceutical development framework template" (problem definition - hypothesis setting - experiment design - result interpretation - improvement strategies). They must earn "excellent" ratings in at least two of three peer evaluation criteria (clarity, practicality, innovativeness).
difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
